intro: Myriophyllum oguraense subsp. yangtzense, commonly known as the Yangtze watermilfoil, is a submerged aquatic plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Pontederiaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, ribbon-like leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically borne in clusters at the base of the leaves. It thrives in freshwater environments such as lakes, rivers, and ponds, where it can form dense underwater vegetation. Its morphology and growth habits make it an important component of aquatic ecosystems in its native range.
